title: أَمَّا الشَّرْطِيَّةُ
description: Learn about أمّا الشرطية - a particle used for topic-comment structure that implies condition and requires فاء in the response.

notes.title: What is أمّا الشرطية?
content: أَمَّا is a conditional particle (حَرْف شَرْط) that introduces a topic and implies 'as for' or 'regarding.' It requires فَاء (called فَاءُ الْجَزَاء or فَاءُ الرَّبْط) in its response.

The meaning of أَمَّا is 'مَهْمَا يَكُنْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ' (whatever the case may be). It introduces different aspects of a topic, often used to contrast multiple items: أَمَّا زَيْدٌ فَكَرِيمٌ وَأَمَّا عَمْرٌو فَبَخِيلٌ.

examples.english: As for Zayd, he is generous
As for knowledge, it is beneficial
As for me, I am traveling
As for the orphan, do not oppress (Quran)

notes.title: The Obligatory فاء
content: The فَاء after أَمَّا is وَاجِبَة (obligatory) - it cannot be omitted. This فَاء is called فَاءُ الرَّبْط (connecting fa) or فَاءُ الْجَزَاء (consequent fa) because it connects the topic to its comment.
Omitting the فَاء is a grammatical error: أَمَّا زَيْدٌ كَرِيمٌ is incorrect. However, in poetry, the فَاء may be deleted for meter (ضَرُورَة شِعْرِيَّة).
keyPoints: Called فَاء الرَّبْط or فَاء الجَزَاء
Can be deleted in poetry only

examples.english: As for Zayd, he is generous (correct)
As for Zayd generous (incorrect - missing فَاء)
As for the Quran, it is healing
As for he who gives and fears Allah, We will ease him (Quran)

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis
content: أَمَّا is a حَرْف شَرْط وَتَفْصِيل (particle of condition and detail), مَبْنِيّ (indeclinable). What follows أَمَّا is typically مُبْتَدَأ (subject), and what follows فَاء is the خَبَر (predicate).
The i'rab: أَمَّا: حَرْف شَرْط مَبْنِيّ. زَيْدٌ: مُبْتَدَأ مَرْفُوع. فَ: فَاء الرَّبْط (or وَاقِعَة فِي جَوَاب أَمَّا). كَرِيمٌ: خَبَر مَرْفُوع.
keyPoints: فَاء: فَاء الرَّبْط or جَوَاب أَمَّا

examples.arabic: أَمَّا: حَرْف شَرْط وَتَفْصِيل مَبْنِيّ لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ
examples.english: أَمَّا: conditional particle, indeclinable, no position
زَيْدٌ: subject, nominative with damma
فَ: connecting fa (or response to أَمَّا)
كَرِيمٌ: predicate, nominative with damma

notes.title: Uses of أمّا
content: أَمَّا is used for التَّفْصِيل (detailing/elaboration) - breaking down a topic into parts. It's common when discussing multiple items: أَمَّا الْأَوَّلُ فَكَذَا وَأَمَّا الثَّانِي فَكَذَا.
It can also be used for التَّوْكِيد (emphasis) and الشَّرْط (condition). The conditional meaning is implicit: 'Whatever else may be, as for X, it is Y.'

examples.arabic: أَمَّا الْغَنِيُّ فَيَتَصَدَّقُ وَأَمَّا الْفَقِيرُ فَيَصْبِرُ
examples.english: As for the rich, he gives charity; as for the poor, he is patient
As for the blessing of your Lord, proclaim it (Quran)
As for the ship, it belonged to poor people (Quran)
As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys (Quran)

notes.title: أمّا in the Quran
content: أَمَّا appears extensively in the Quran, especially in Surah Al-Layl (92) and Surah Ad-Duha (93). It structures the discourse by presenting contrasting scenarios or detailing various aspects.
In Surah Al-Kahf (18:79-82), أَمَّا is used three times to explain Khidr's actions: أَمَّا السَّفِينَةُ... أَمَّا الْغُلَامُ... وَأَمَّا الْجِدَارُ...
keyPoints: Surah Al-Kahf: three uses explaining Khidr

examples.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَى وَاتَّقَى... فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَى
examples.english: As for who gives and fears... We will ease him to ease (92:5-7)

examples.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَى... فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَى
examples.english: As for who withholds and thinks himself free... We will ease him to hardship (92:8-10)
As for the orphan, do not oppress (93:9)
As for the petitioner, do not repel (93:10)

notes.title: Difference from إمّا
content: أَمَّا (with فَتْحَة on hamza) differs from إِمَّا (with كَسْرَة). أَمَّا is for التَّفْصِيل (detailing) and requires فَاء. إِمَّا is for التَّخْيِير أَوْ الشَّكّ (choice or doubt) and uses أَوْ.
Compare: أَمَّا زَيْدٌ فَذَهَبَ وَأَمَّا عَمْرٌو فَبَقِيَ (detailing) vs. جَاءَ إِمَّا زَيْدٌ وَإِمَّا عَمْرٌو (one of them came - doubt/choice).
keyPoints: إِمَّا (كَسْرَة): choice/doubt, uses أَوْ or إِمَّا...إِمَّا

examples.english: As for Zayd, he went (detailing)
Either Zayd or Amr came (choice)
Either grateful or ungrateful (76:3)
As for those who believe, they know (detailing)
